column4: alright, I'm having a very frustrating time with this error message: "Ubuntu is running in low-graphics mode." I've been trying to fix it for several hours and I've gotten nowhere. Is there anyone that can help me with this?
also, I think it's https://bugs.freedesktop.org/show_bug.cgi?id=31154 this bug
what graphic card
not sure if you saw that. But just in case, it's an ATI Radeon X1200
nope didn't.. sounds like an older one is that right?
yeah, it is

I'm not sure if the drivers have caught up with it .. when x.org changed to 7.x or was it 1.7x something like that.. it broke compatability for older ati cards and ati decited to put efforts into their newer stuff first.. not sure if there is a fix or not.
perhaps in ##linux
how do you mean "earlier".. on 8.04 or 9.10?
any recent updates?
none
I was restarting to get back in ubuntu (I was in vista doing something) and when I booted ubunut up it gave me that error
do a full update with .. sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade .. then look in system>admin>hardware drivers and see if there's something there to activate.
hadn't thought of that.. is this a Wubi install?
do the update as a first step
which update?
check for your highlight line from me above..
do a full update with .. sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade .. then look in system>admin>hardware drivers and see if there's something there to activate.
I'm in cli, because I can't access the gui with this error. But when I did the upgrade there was apparently nothing to upgrade to. 0 upgraded, 0 newly, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
well.. it was worth a shot.. sorry I'm not much of an ati person.. I've no idea how to fix it.
sigh, no one seems to know anything about this error. DO you have any suggestions for where else to ask for help?
maybe in ##linux. I had the same on my install with nvidia.. I needed to install the binary driver to fix it.. it may also have something to do with xrandr which controls screen resoution etc.
alright I'll check those out. Thanks for the help
good luck
